result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. AMANDA J WESTOVER

records.addlTxt: Taycheedah Correctional Institution - 01/24/2023 at 12:30 PM (PSI Sentencing)
Sentencing hearing on January 24, 2023 at 01:00 pm. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Taycheedah Correctional)

2:37 PM Defendant AMANDA J WESTOVER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore R Rolfs appeared by video for AMANDA J WESTOVER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Court goes over right to appear in person in court and next to her attorney. Court goes over breakout room. Defendant does not need to talk with her attorney. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 2 & 4 with request for Presentence investigation and to count 6 with jail, costs and DNA sample. DA concurs. Atty Rolfs concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2, 4 & 6 and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days. 

Court adjourned at 2:46 PM

Court sets for (PSI) Sentencing on January 24, 2023 at 1:00 PM (1/2 hr)
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Taycheedah Correctional)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Statement by Atty Rolf, def has other cases and is looking for a different structure. Atty Rolf requests a plea and sentencing. Court has no problem with the def appearing by zoom. Defendant AMANDA J WESTOVER not in court.  Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court for AMANDA J WESTOVER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court sets plea/sentencing for Oct 25, 2022 at 1:15 PM.

10:53 AM Defendant AMANDA J WESTOVER appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Theodore R Rolfs appeared in court for AMANDA J WESTOVER, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Rolfs regarding bond modification - def cannot get accepted in the drug court program if she is in custody. DA Laspisa objects to bond modification. Court amends it to $1,000 cash bond upon defendant being ordered in to drug court. Atty Rolf states the def will waive the prelim. Def concurs - will waive the preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and states it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Rolfs acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Rolfs enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return date May 16, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:01 AM.
